summary.incident:
Nicolo Rovella (Lazio) makes it easy for
the referee to show him a yellow card.

Nicolo Rovella is substituted due to injury.
Maurizio Sarri gives a chance to Danilo
Cataldi (Lazio).

Tarik Muharemovic (Sassuolo) is rightly
booked by the referee because it could not
have been anything other than a yellow card.

Substitution. Woyo Coulibaly (Sassuolo)
in, Sebastian Walukiewicz out.

Maurizio Sarri decides to make a substitution.
Fisayo Dele-Bashiru will be replaced by
Reda Belahyane (Lazio).

Josh Doig (Sassuolo) is given a fully deserved
yellow card.

Here's the change. Taty Castellanos leaves
the pitch and Boulaye Dia (Lazio) comes
on as a substitute.

Maurizio Sarri has decided to make a change.
Pedro (Lazio) replaces Matteo Cancellieri.

The manager has decided to make a substitution
and Armand Lauriente walks off the pitch
to be replaced by Alieu Fadera (Sassuolo).

Fabio Grosso prepares a substitution. Aster
Vranckx is replaced by Cristian Volpato
(Sassuolo).

Goal! Alieu Fadera (Sassuolo) pounced on
a loose ball inside the box and beats the
goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left
corner. He makes it 1:0.

The referee is firm and issues Andrea Pinamonti
(Sassuolo) a deserved yellow card.

Here is a change. Matteo Guendouzi is going
off and Maurizio Sarri gives the last tactical
orders to Gustav Isaksen (Lazio).

Substitution. Domenico Berardi makes his
way off the pitch and Edoardo Pieragnolo
(Sassuolo) comes on as his replacement.

Andrea Pinamonti goes off the pitch and
Walid Cheddira (Sassuolo) comes on.

Reda Belahyane (Lazio) picked up a yellow
card from referee.

The referee gives a yellow card to Nemanja
Matic (Sassuolo).

Cristian Volpato (Sassuolo) is booked by
the referee.

Goal! The corner is whipped in and Giorgio
Scalvini (Atalanta) is in the right place
at the right time, planting his header perfectly
into the right side of the goal. He makes
it 1:0.

Goal! Nikola Krstovic pulls the ball back
for Charles De Ketelaere (Atalanta) on the
edge of the box, and he beats the keeper
with a fine strike into the bottom right
corner. 2:0.

We are about to witness a substitution.
Marco Brescianini (Atalanta) is replacing
Mario Pasalic.

Eusebio Di Francesco has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Santiago Pierotti (Lecce)
replacing Riccardo Sottil.

Alex Sala will be replaced by Konan Ndri
(Lecce).

Goal! Nikola Krstovic puts Nicola Zalewski
(Atalanta) in the clear with just the keeper
to beat. He takes his shot early from the
edge of the box and scores beautifully into
the bottom left corner. 3:0.

It is time for a substitution. Francesco
Camarda (Lecce) is on for Nikola Stulic.

Here is a change. Christ-Owen Kouassi is
going off and Eusebio Di Francesco gives
the last tactical orders to Danilo Veiga
(Lecce).

GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal.
The defender ends up losing possession,
allowing Charles De Ketelaere (Atalanta)
to pick up the ball before slotting it into
the back of the net to make it 4:0.

Charles De Ketelaere comes off the pitch
to be replaced by Lazar Samardzic (Atalanta).

Kamaldeen Sulemana goes off the pitch and
Daniel Maldini (Atalanta) comes on.

Ivan Juric decides to make a substitution.
Marten de Roon will be replaced by Yunus
Musah (Atalanta).

Substitution. Jamil Siebert leaves the pitch
and is replaced by Tiago Gabriel (Lecce).

Brilliant finish! Konan Ndri (Lecce) perfectly
collected a pass on the edge of the penalty
area from Danilo Veiga, then produced a
nice strike into the top left corner. The
score is 4:1.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Lorenzo Bernasconi (Atalanta)
comes onto the pitch for Nicola Zalewski.

Antonio Caracciolo (Pisa) shouldn't be surprised
it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the
situation down well.

Goal! Iker Bravo (Udinese) fires the rebound
inside the right post after the ball breaks
to him in the box. The score is 0:1.

Hassane Kamara (Udinese) is booked after
bringing down an opponent. Davide Massa
had an easy-decision to make.

Half-time substitution. Stefano Moreo (Pisa)
will not participate anymore and M'Bala
Nzola is coming on.

The teams are back out for the second half
and here is a change on the pitch. Alberto
Gilardino gives a chance to Mehdi Pascal
Marcel Leris and Samuele Angori (Pisa) is
off.

There will be a change on the pitch for
the second half. Alberto Gilardino probably
wasn't satisfied with the performance of
Mateus Lusuardi (Pisa). He is replaced by
Giovanni Bonfanti.

The manager has decided to make a substitution
and Jakub Piotrowski walks off the pitch
to be replaced by Oier Zarraga (Udinese).

Here is a change. Keinan Davis is going
off and Kosta Runjaic gives the last tactical
orders to Adam Buksa (Udinese).

Substitution. Nicolo Zaniolo (Udinese) in,
Iker Bravo out.

Substitution. Hassane Kamara will be replaced
by Jordan Zemura (Udinese).

Kosta Runjaic has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Saba Goglichidze (Udinese) replacing
Nicolo Bertola.

It is time for a substitution. Gabriele
Piccinini (Pisa) is on for Michel Aebischer.

Alberto Gilardino prepares a substitution.
Matteo Tramoni is replaced by Calvin Stengs
(Pisa).

Jesper Karlstrom (Udinese) sees a yellow
card from Davide Massa after he sent one
of the opposing players to the ground.

Giovanni Ayroldi shows a yellow card to
Kristjan Asllani (Torino) for a tough tackle.

Ardian Ismajli (Torino) sees a yellow card
from Giovanni Ayroldi after he sent one
of the opposing players to the ground.

The teams are back out for the second half
and here is a change on the pitch. Gian
Piero Gasperini gives a chance to Evan Ferguson
and Neil El Aynaoui (AS Roma) is off.

Half-time substitution. Paulo Dybala (AS
Roma) will not participate anymore and Tommaso
Baldanzi is coming on.

Giovanni Ayroldi shows a yellow card to
Wesley Franca (AS Roma), who isn't surprised
as the tackle was really hard and late.

Brilliant finish! Giovanni Simeone (Torino)
perfectly collected a pass on the edge of
the penalty area from Cyril Ngonge, then
produced a nice strike into the right side
of the goal. The score is 0:1.

Cyril Ngonge will be replaced by Zakaria
Aboukhlal (Torino).

Marco Baroni prepares a substitution. Cesare
Casadei is replaced by Ivan Ilic (Torino).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Giovanni Simeone leaves
the pitch and Che Adams (Torino) comes on.

Here comes a substitution. Niccolo Pisilli
(AS Roma) is brought on as a substitute
for Bryan Cristante.

Angelino (AS Roma) is awarded a yellow card.
The referee showed him no mercy.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Mario Hermoso departs the
field of play to be replaced by Zeki Celik
(AS Roma).

Gian Piero Gasperini decides to make a substitution.
Angelino will be replaced by Stephan El
Shaarawy (AS Roma).

Kristjan Asllani comes off the pitch to
be replaced by Adrien Tameze (Torino).

The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate
this behaviour. Zakaria Aboukhlal (Torino)
is given a yellow card.

Substitution. Faustino Anjorin (Torino)
receives a signal from the referee and is
now allowed to enter the pitch as Nikola
Vlasic walks off.

GOAL! That’s a great strike from the spot
by Kevin De Bruyne (Napoli) low into the
left of the net, giving goalkeeper David
de Gea no chance!

Goal! Leonardo Spinazzola displays great
vision and sends a pass to Rasmus Hojlund
(Napoli), who shows brilliant composure
inside the box to bury the ball into the
bottom right corner. The score is 0:2.

Substitution. Edin Dzeko leaves the pitch
and is replaced by Roberto Piccoli (Fiorentina).

Goal! Frank Anguissa feeds Sam Beukema (Napoli),
who taps the ball into an empty net. He
makes it 0:3.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Nicolo Fagioli trots off
the pitch and is replaced by Hans Nicolussi
Caviglia (Fiorentina).

Here is a change. Simon Sohm is going off
and Stefano Pioli gives the last tactical
orders to Jacopo Fazzini (Fiorentina).

Here's the change. Matteo Politano leaves
the pitch and David Neres (Napoli) comes
on as a substitute.

Substitution. Eljif Elmas (Napoli) on for
Kevin De Bruyne.

Antonio Conte has decided to make a change.
Mathias Olivera (Napoli) replaces Leonardo
Spinazzola.

Antonio Conte decides to make a substitution.
Rasmus Hojlund will be replaced by Lorenzo
Lucca (Napoli).

Luca Ranieri (Fiorentina) scores from the
corner kick. The ball slipped through the
box to Luca Ranieri (Fiorentina) and he
slotted it past the goalkeeper.

Stefano Pioli (Fiorentina) gets a yellow
card, off the field.

Tariq Lamptey (Fiorentina) joins the action
as a substitute, replacing Pietro Comuzzo.

Antonio Conte has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Billy Gilmour (Napoli) replacing
Stanislav Lobotka.

Substitution. Marin Pongracic will be replaced
by Mattia Viti (Fiorentina).

Lloyd Kelly (Juventus) converts a killer
cross with a precise low shot that goes
into the bottom right corner. What a brilliant
finish!

Goal! Hakan Calhanoglu (Inter) latches on
to an accurate pass and quickly strikes
a low effort inside the right post.

Teun Koopmeiners (Juventus) is literally
asking for a yellow card with his behaviour.
The referee agrees and books him.

What a beautiful moment! Kenan Yildiz (Juventus)
got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot
from distance. It turned out to be a good
decision as his effort found its way into
the bottom left corner. Yann Sommer just
shakes his head in disbelief. The score
changes to 2:1.

Federico Dimarco (Inter) joins the action
as a substitute, replacing Carlos Augusto.

Cristian Chivu prepares a substitution.
Lautaro Martinez is replaced by Ange-Yoan
Bonny (Inter).

Cristian Chivu has decided to substitute
Nicolo Barella and he is replaced by Piotr
Zielinski (Inter).

Hakan Calhanoglu (Inter) takes a great first
touch to control a killer pass on the edge
of the box and drills a shot into the bottom
left corner in trademark fashion.

The foul by Manuel Locatelli (Juventus)
is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly
shown by Andrea Colombo.

Igor Tudor decides to make a substitution.
Manuel Locatelli will be replaced by Juan
Cabal (Juventus).

Substitution. Dusan Vlahovic makes his way
off the pitch and Lois Openda (Juventus)
comes on as his replacement.

The substitution has been made. Vasilije
Adzic (Juventus) has replaced Teun Koopmeiners.

Marcus Thuram (Inter) outjumps the defence
inside the six-yard box to meet the corner
and scores with a great header into the
bottom left corner. The keeper had no chance
to react. The score is now 2:3.

Substitution. Denzel Dumfries will be replaced
by Matteo Darmian (Inter).

Here is a change. Weston McKennie is going
off and Igor Tudor gives the last tactical
orders to Jonathan David (Juventus).

Substitution. Federico Gatti makes way for
Joao Mario (Juventus).

The game has come to an end for Hakan Calhanoglu.
He has contributed as much as he could today.
He will be replaced by the fresh legs of
Petar Sucic (Inter).

Goal! Khephren Thuram (Juventus) peels away
from his marker to meet the resulting free
kick from Kenan Yildiz, and he steers a
powerful header from near the penalty spot
low inside the right post. What a finish
that is - 3:3!

Andrea Colombo shows the yellow card to
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Inter) for a heavy challenge.

What a goal! Vasilije Adzic (Juventus) receives
an accurate pass and tries his luck with
a long-range shot. He unleashes a superb
strike that goes into the top left corner
and behind the goalkeeper.

Gabriele Zappa (Cagliari) picks up a yellow
card for a foul.

Francesco Fourneau shows a yellow card to
Christian Ordonez (Parma), who isn't surprised
as the tackle was really hard and late.

Yerry Mina (Cagliari) gets to a rebound
inside the six-yard box and produces a header.
He manages to put the ball into the roof
of the net, and thus alter the score to
1:0.

Carlos Cuesta decides to make a substitution.
Christian Ordonez will be replaced by Gaetano
Oristanio (Parma).

The referee signals a substitution. Alessandro
Deiola (Cagliari) is brought on as a substitute
for Gianluca Gaetano.

Fabio Pisacane has decided to substitute
Gabriele Zappa and he is replaced by Marco
Palestra (Cagliari).

Sebastiano Esposito (Cagliari) is awarded
a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't
seem to agree with the decision, but Francesco
Fourneau ignores the protests.

Francesco Fourneau shows the yellow card
to Alessandro Deiola (Cagliari) for a heavy
challenge.

Carlos Cuesta has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Pontus Almqvist (Parma) replacing
Mathias Lovik.

The manager has been forced to make a substitution
and the injured Andrea Belotti leaves the
pitch to be replaced by Gennaro Borrelli
(Cagliari).

Here is a change. Sebastiano Esposito is
going off and Fabio Pisacane gives the last
tactical orders to Mattia Felici (Cagliari).

Goal! Mattia Felici (Cagliari) fires the
rebound into the bottom right corner after
the ball breaks to him in the box. The score
is 2:0.

Carlos Cuesta is forced to make an unplanned
substitution as Adrian Bernabe Garcia (Parma)
suffers an injury and Nahuel Estevez comes
on.

The referee allows time for a substitution.
Patrick Cutrone will be replaced by Milan
Djuric (Parma).

Carlos Cuesta prepares a substitution. Oliver
Sorensen is replaced by Mandela Keita (Parma).

A substitution has been made. Michael Folorunsho
goes off and Jose Pedro (Cagliari) comes
on.

Goal! Denzel Dumfries (Inter) scores after
an assist by Marcus Thuram that allowed
him to tap in the ball into an empty net.
The score is 1:0.

Goal! Keinan Davis (Udinese) wins the battle
of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty
past Yann Sommer into the bottom right corner.

Nicolo Bertola (Udinese) has tested the
patience of referee Matteo Marchetti and
goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Arthur Atta (Udinese) takes a great first
touch to control a killer pass on the edge
of the box and curls the ball inside the
right post in trademark fashion.

There will be a change on the pitch for
the second half. Kosta Runjaic probably
wasn't satisfied with the performance of
Nicolo Bertola (Udinese). He is replaced
by Saba Goglichidze.

Here comes the VAR verdict. NO GOAL for
Inter due to an offside in the build-up
play.

Cristian Chivu decides to make a substitution.
Petar Sucic will be replaced by Henrikh
Mkhitaryan (Inter).

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Adam Buksa (Udinese)
will replace Vakoun Issouf Bayo.

We are about to witness a subsitution. Francesco
Pio Esposito (Inter) for Hakan Calhanoglu.

Kosta Runjaic has decided to substitute
Jakub Piotrowski and he is replaced by Oier
Zarraga (Udinese).

Substitution. Keinan Davis will be replaced
by Jurgen Ekkelenkamp (Udinese).

Razvan Sava (Udinese) is rightly booked
by the referee because it could not have
been anything other than a yellow card.

It's time for a substitution. Rui Modesto
(Udinese) comes on in place of Kingsley
Ehizibue.

Substitution. Nicolo Barella makes his way
off the pitch and Piotr Zielinski (Inter)
comes on as his replacement.

Here is a change. Francesco Acerbi is going
off and Cristian Chivu gives the last tactical
orders to Ange-Yoan Bonny (Inter).

Today's match ends for Federico Dimarco
who will be replaced by Carlos Augusto (Inter).

Lautaro Martinez (Inter) goes into the book
for bad language. His vulgar comments could
have made it worse. Luckily for him, it's
a yellow card.
Oier Zarraga (Udinese) is penalised.

Goal! Great link up play between Matteo
Guendouzi (Lazio) and Taty Castellanos gives
the former a clear sight of goal on the
edge of the box. He doesn't disappoint and
beats the keeper in the bottom left corner.
1:0.

Goal! Mattia Zaccagni (Lazio) finds himself
some space inside the box to get on the
end of a pass from Taty Castellanos, then
sends the ball into the bottom right corner.
2:0.

It's in the back of the net! Taty Castellanos
(Lazio) rises high inside the six-yard box
to meet a cross by Nicolo Rovella from the
free kick. He heads home into the middle
of the goal, making the score 3:0.

Here is a change after the half-time break.
Fallou Cham (Verona) is replaced by Armel
Bella-Kotchap.

Paolo Zanetti makes a half-time substitution.
Martin Frese comes on in place of Enzo Ebosse
(Verona).

Half-time substitution. Abdou Harroui (Verona)
will not participate anymore and Al Musrati
is coming on.

The substitution has been made. Luca Pellegrini
(Lazio) has replaced Nuno Tavares.

Maurizio Sarri has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Pedro (Lazio) replacing
Mattia Zaccagni.

A substitution has been made. Antoine Bernede
is replaced by Rafik Belghali (Verona).

Substitution. Fisayo Dele-Bashiru is replaced
by Reda Belahyane (Lazio).

Maurizio Sarri has decided to make a change.
Boulaye Dia (Lazio) replaces Taty Castellanos.

Daniel Mosquera (Verona) joins the action
as a substitute, replacing Amin Sarr.

It's in the back of the net! Reda Belahyane
sprays a pass out to Boulaye Dia (Lazio),
and he has an easy job to slot the ball
into an empty net. The score is 4:0.

Substitution. Elseid Hysaj (Lazio) replaces
Adam Marusic.

Joao Mario (Juventus) is booked after bringing
down an opponent. Daniele Chiffi had an
easy-decision to make.

Igor Tudor has decided to make a change.
Filip Kostic replaces Joao Mario (Juventus).

The substitution is prepared. Teun Koopmeiners
joins the action as a substitute, replacing
Manuel Locatelli (Juventus).

Igor Tudor prepares a substitution. Jonathan
David (Juventus) is replaced by Dusan Vlahovic.

The referee allows time for a substitution.
Nicolae Stanciu (Genoa) will be replaced
by Morten Thorsby.

Patrick Vieira has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Ruslan Malinovskyi replacing
Valentin Carboni (Genoa).

Leo Ostigard (Genoa) takes his opponent
down and receives a yellow card from the
referee.

The ball was swung into the box by Filip
Kostic from the corner kick. He perfectly
found the head of Dusan Vlahovic (Juventus),
who planted a long-range header inside the
right post to make the score 0:1.

Patrick Vieira decides to make a substitution.
Mikael Egill Ellertsson will be replaced
by Vitinha (Genoa).

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Jeff Ekhator (Genoa)
will replace Morten Frendrup.

Caleb Ekuban (Genoa) joins the action as
a substitute, replacing Lorenzo Colombo.

Teun Koopmeiners (Juventus) receives a yellow
card for a nasty tackle.

A substitution has been made. Francisco
Conceicao (Juventus) goes off and Nicolas
Gonzalez comes on.

Substitution. Kenan Yildiz leaves the pitch
and is replaced by Weston McKennie (Juventus).

Simon Sohm (Fiorentina) is booked after
bringing down an opponent. Rosario Abisso
had an easy-decision to make.

Nikola Vlasic (Torino) receives a yellow
card for a nasty tackle.

There will be a change on the pitch for
the second half. Stefano Pioli probably
wasn't satisfied with the performance of
Pietro Comuzzo (Fiorentina). He is replaced
by Eddy Kouadio.

Stefano Pioli makes a switch. Nicolo Fagioli
is coming on in place of Simon Sohm (Fiorentina)
at the start of the second period.

Marco Baroni has decided to substitute Giovanni
Simeone and he is replaced by Che Adams
(Torino).

That's the end of the game for Rolando Mandragora,
who is replaced by Cher Ndour (Fiorentina).

Marin Pongracic (Fiorentina) has tested
the patience of referee Rosario Abisso and
goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Gvidas Gineitis (Torino)
will replace Ivan Ilic.

Marco Baroni has decided to make a change.
Valentino Lazaro (Torino) replaces Cristiano
Biraghi.

Roberto Piccoli will be replaced by Edin
Dzeko (Fiorentina).

Marco Baroni prepares a substitution. Kristjan
Asllani is replaced by Adrien Tameze (Torino).

Zakaria Aboukhlal (Torino) joins the action
as a substitute, replacing Cyril Ngonge.

Today's match ends for Albert Gudmundsson
who will be replaced by Jacopo Fazzini (Fiorentina).

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Valentino Lazaro (Torino) was quite harsh
and Rosario Abisso didn't hesitate to show
him a yellow card.

Gabriele Zappa (Cagliari) takes out his
opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved
when the referee only shows him a yellow
card.

Kevin De Bruyne (Napoli) violates the laws
of the game and is shown a yellow card by
the referee, but it could have been a straight
red as well.

A substitution has been made. Gabriele Zappa
is replaced by Zito Luvumbo (Cagliari).

Fabio Pisacane has decided to make a change.
Gianluca Gaetano (Cagliari) replaces Matteo
Prati.

The game has come to an end for Sebastiano
Esposito. He has contributed as much as
he could today. He will be replaced by the
fresh legs of Gennaro Borrelli (Cagliari).

Yellow card. Juan Jesus (Napoli) goes into
the referee's book after a bad challenge.

Antonio Conte prepares a substitution. Juan
Jesus is replaced by Alessandro Buongiorno
(Napoli).

Substitution. Lorenzo Lucca will be replaced
by Giuseppe Ambrosino (Napoli).

Substitution. Kevin De Bruyne is replaced
by Noa Lang (Napoli).

Antonio Conte has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Mathias Olivera (Napoli) replacing
Leonardo Spinazzola.

Michael Folorunsho comes off the pitch to
be replaced by Riyad Idrissi (Cagliari).

Fabio Pisacane decides to make a substitution.
Marco Palestra will be replaced by Alessandro
Di Pardo (Cagliari).

GOAL! Superb work from Alessandro Buongiorno,
who plays a vital role in the build-up.
He squares it to Frank Anguissa (Napoli),
who beats Elia Caprile with a brilliant
shot into the bottom right corner. 1:0.

Marius Marin (Pisa) is awarded a yellow
card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to
agree with the decision, but Giuseppe Collu
ignores the protests.

A yellow card for a tackle by Evan Ferguson
(AS Roma). Giuseppe Collu doesn't hesitate
at all to make this decision.

The teams are back out for the second half
and here is a change on the pitch. Gian
Piero Gasperini gives a chance to Paulo
Dybala (AS Roma) and Stephan El Shaarawy
is off.

Matias Soule (AS Roma) receives a well-taken
defence-splitting pass inside the box and
scores! He buries the ball into the bottom
left corner.

Mateus Lusuardi goes off the pitch and Arturo
Calabresi (Pisa) comes on.

Alberto Gilardino decides to make a substitution.
Matteo Tramoni will be replaced by Juan
Cuadrado (Pisa).

The manager has decided to make a substitution
and Stefano Moreo walks off the pitch to
be replaced by M'Bala Nzola (Pisa).

Substitution. Evan Ferguson walks off the
pitch and Artem Dovbyk (AS Roma) comes on
as a substitute.

Substitution. Mario Hermoso makes his way
off the pitch and Zeki Celik (AS Roma) comes
on as his replacement.

Alberto Gilardino prepares a substitution.
Marius Marin is replaced by Calvin Stengs
(Pisa).

That will be all from Samuele Angori who
is being replaced by the fresh legs of Mehdi
Pascal Marcel Leris (Pisa).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Devyne Rensch (AS Roma)
comes onto the pitch for Angelino.

The game has come to an end for Matias Soule.
He has contributed as much as he could today.
He will be replaced by the fresh legs of
Neil El Aynaoui (AS Roma).

Henrik Meister (Pisa) sees a yellow card
from Giuseppe Collu after he sent one of
the opposing players to the ground.

A yellow card for a tackle by Nicolo Cambiaghi
(Bologna). Daniele Doveri doesn't hesitate
at all to make this decision.

Problems for Cesc Fabregas as Ignace Van
der Brempt is not able to play anymore.
His injury is too serious and Ivan Smolcic
(Como) replaces him.

Maximo Perrone (Como) is awarded a yellow
card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to
agree with the decision, but Daniele Doveri
ignores the protests.

Daniele Doveri shows the yellow card to
Ivan Smolcic (Como) for a heavy challenge.

The foul by Martin Vitik (Bologna) is worthy
of a card and a yellow is duly shown by
Daniele Doveri.

Half-time substitution. Martin Vitik (Bologna)
will not participate anymore and Jhon Lucumi
is coming on.

Cesc Fabregas has decided to make a substitution
during the half-time break. Sergi Roberto
comes on the pitch for Maximo Perrone (Como).

It's time for a substitution. Nicolas-Gerrit
Kuhn (Como) comes on in place of Mergim
Vojvoda.

Cesc Fabregas decides to make a substitution.
Anastasios Douvikas will be replaced by
Alvaro Morata (Como).

What a hit! Riccardo Orsolini (Bologna)
shows good composure inside the box to fire
a first-time shot into the bottom right
corner. 1:0.

Vincenzo Italiano has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Tommaso Pobega (Bologna)
replacing Nikola Moro.

The referee allows time for a substitution.
Giovanni Fabbian will be replaced by Jens
Odgaard (Bologna).

Jhon Lucumi (Bologna) sees a yellow card
from Daniele Doveri after he sent one of
the opposing players to the ground.

We are about to witness a subsitution. Thijs
Dallinga (Bologna) for Santiago Castro.

Today's referee Daniele Doveri rightly decides
to book Jacobo Ramon (Como) for his harsh
tackle.

Daniele Doveri shows a yellow card to Tommaso
Pobega (Bologna), who isn't surprised as
the tackle was really hard and late.

Today's match ends for Lucas Da Cunha who
will be replaced by Martin Baturina (Como).

The game has come to an end for Charalampos
Lykogiannis. He has contributed as much
as he could today. He will be replaced by
the fresh legs of Juan Miranda (Bologna).

The game has come to an end for Pontus Almqvist.
He has contributed as much as he could today.
He will be replaced by the fresh legs of
Gaetano Oristanio (Parma).

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Nikola Krstovic (Atalanta)
comes onto the pitch so that Gianluca Scamacca
can be given a rest.

Ivan Juric decides to make a substitution.
Nicola Zalewski will be replaced by Davide
Zappacosta (Atalanta).

Daniel Maldini goes off the pitch and Kamaldeen
Sulemana (Atalanta) comes on.

Maurizio Mariani shows a yellow card to
Isak Hien (Atalanta) for a tough tackle.

Lautaro Valenti (Parma) is awarded a yellow
card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to
agree with the decision, but Maurizio Mariani
ignores the protests.

Mario Pasalic (Atalanta) scores! He latches
on to a pass and produces a perfect strike
from the edge of the box that goes inside
the left post and past the goalkeeper.

Substitution. Patrick Cutrone replaces Oliver
Sorensen (Parma).

Here is a change. Mandela Keita is going
off and Carlos Cuesta gives the last tactical
orders to Christian Ordonez (Parma).

Goal! Patrick Cutrone (Parma) fires the
rebound inside the left post after the ball
breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.

A substitution has been made. Giorgio Scalvini
is replaced by Marco Brescianini (Atalanta).

Substitution. Nahuel Estevez (Parma) receives
a signal from the referee and is now allowed
to enter the pitch as Adrian Bernabe Garcia
walks off.

Maurizio Mariani has issued a yellow card
to Gaetano Oristanio (Parma).

The expression of the referee Maurizio Mariani
is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be
tolerated. Marten de Roon (Atalanta) is
shown a yellow card.

Celebrations are cut short for AC Milan
as the referee indicates NO GOAL after the
VAR review due to a foul in the build-up
play.

Eusebio Di Francesco makes a switch. Nikola
Stulic is coming on in place of Francesco
Camarda (Lecce) at the start of the second
period.

Celebrations are cut short for AC Milan
as the referee indicates NO GOAL after the
VAR review shows it was offside!

It will be a substitution. Riccardo Sottil
(Lecce) is ready to enter the pitch as Santiago
Pierotti walks off.

Eusebio Di Francesco has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Medon Berisha (Lecce) replacing
Mohamed Kaba.

Today's referee Livio Marinelli rightly
decides to book Kialonda Gaspar (Lecce)
for his harsh tackle.

Ruben Loftus-Cheek (AC Milan) celebrates
a stunning goal. He manages to win himself
just enough space inside the box to meet
the free kick and powers a perfectly placed
header inside the right post.

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Samuele Ricci (AC Milan)
will replace Ruben Loftus-Cheek.

Massimiliano Allegri decides to make a substitution.
Alexis Saelemaekers will be replaced by
Christian Pulisic (AC Milan).

Today's match ends for Ylber Ramadani who
will be replaced by Thorir Johann Helgason
(Lecce).

Here is a change. Tete Morente is going
off and Eusebio Di Francesco gives the last
tactical orders to Konan Ndri (Lecce).

Goal! Christian Pulisic (AC Milan) pounced
on a loose ball inside the box and beats
the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom
left corner. He makes it 0:2.

The substitution is prepared. Cheveyo Mul
(AC Milan) joins the action as a substitute,
replacing Santiago Tomas Gimenez.

Marco Guida shows a yellow card to Antonio
Sanabria (Cremonese) for a tough tackle.

Filippo Terracciano (Cremonese) gets on
the end of the corner and powers a header
into the bottom left corner.

Goal! Franco Vazquez (Cremonese) scores
after an assist by Antonio Sanabria that
allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty
net. The score is 2:0.

Marco Guida shows the yellow card to Josh
Doig (Sassuolo) for a heavy challenge.

Half-time substitution. Daniel Boloca (Sassuolo)
is replaced by Cristian Volpato.

Fabio Grosso has made a change at the break.
Fali Cande has come on in place of Josh
Doig (Sassuolo).

Goal! Cristian Volpato provides Andrea Pinamonti
(Sassuolo) with a nice pass inside the box.
It allows him to finish with a precise effort
into the bottom left corner. 2:1.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Warren Bondo departs the
field of play to be replaced by Alberto
Grassi (Cremonese).

Fabio Grosso prepares a substitution. Armand
Lauriente is replaced by Alieu Fadera (Sassuolo).

Substitution. Aster Vranckx is replaced
by Luca Lipani (Sassuolo).

Today's referee Marco Guida rightly decides
to book Alberto Grassi (Cremonese) for his
harsh tackle.

GOAL! That’s a great strike from the spot
by Domenico Berardi (Sassuolo) low into
the right of the net, giving goalkeeper
Emil Audero no chance!

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Jari Vandeputte leaves the
pitch and Martin Payero (Cremonese) comes
on.

Davide Nicola has decided to make a change.
David Okereke (Cremonese) replaces Franco
Vazquez.

It's time for a substitution. That's the
last involvement from Nemanja Matic as he
is replaced by Edoardo Iannoni (Sassuolo).

Substitution. Romano Floriani (Cremonese)
in, Alessio Zerbin out.

Davide Nicola decides to make a substitution.
Antonio Sanabria will be replaced by Manuel
De Luca (Cremonese).

Goal! Manuel De Luca (Cremonese) wins the
battle of wills and sends an unstoppable
penalty past Arijanet Muric into middle
of the goal.

Marco Guida shows a yellow card to Edoardo
Iannoni (Sassuolo), who isn't surprised
as the tackle was really hard and late.

Alessandro Bastoni (Inter) jumped highest
inside the box to meet a perfectly executed
corner kick by Nicolo Barella. His header
bounced off the ground and went inside the
right post behind the goalkeeper. It's 1:0.

Marcus Thuram (Inter) latches on to a precise
pass deep inside the box from Petar Sucic,
and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate
shot into the bottom left corner. He makes
it 2:0.

Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted
a chance to a lurking Lautaro Martinez (Inter),
who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into
the net from close range. 3:0.

Here's the change. Nikola Vlasic leaves
the pitch and Zakaria Aboukhlal (Torino)
comes on as a substitute.

Marco Baroni has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Adrien Tameze (Torino) replacing
Emirhan Ilkhan.

Goal! Alessandro Bastoni picks out Marcus
Thuram (Inter) with a perfect cross, and
he has no problem to nod the ball into an
empty net. It's 4:0.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Che Adams (Torino) comes
onto the pitch for Giovanni Simeone.

Cristian Chivu decides to make a substitution.
Federico Dimarco will be replaced by Carlos
Augusto (Inter).

Substitution. Marcus Thuram makes way for
Ange-Yoan Bonny (Inter).

Goal Ange-Yoan Bonny (Inter)! Ange-Yoan
Bonny (Inter) was put through by Lautaro
Martinez and he showed brilliant composure
to tuck it home from inside the box. 5:0.

Cristian Chivu has decided to substitute
Lautaro Martinez and he is replaced by Andy
Diouf (Inter).

The referee signals a substitution. Piotr
Zielinski (Inter) is brought on as a substitute
for Henrikh Mkhitaryan.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Valentino Lazaro trots off
the pitch and is replaced by Faustino Anjorin
(Torino).

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Marcus Pedersen (Torino)
comes onto the pitch so that Cyril Ngonge
can be given a rest.

Cristian Chivu has decided to make a change.
Luis Henrique (Inter) replaces Alessandro
Bastoni.

Iker Bravo (Udinese) is booked after bringing
down an opponent. Paride Tremolada had an
easy-decision to make.

Sandi Lovric takes over corner duties and
expertly finds Thomas Kristensen (Udinese),
who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet
header low into the middle of the goal.
He makes it 1:0.

It's time for a substitution. Oier Zarraga
(Udinese) comes on in place of Sandi Lovric.

Kosta Runjaic has decided to make a change.
Vakoun Issouf Bayo (Udinese) replaces Iker
Bravo.

Substitution. Abdou Harroui (Verona) has
come on for Cheikh Niasse.

Paolo Zanetti prepares a substitution. Amin
Sarr is replaced by Daniel Mosquera (Verona).

Keinan Davis (Udinese) will have to be careful
for the rest of the match as he is shown
a yellow card.

We are about to witness a substitution.
Rafik Belghali (Verona) is replacing Domagoj
Bradaric.

Goal! The resulting corner is whipped into
the box and Suat Serdar (Verona) buries
the ball into the back of the net from a
Giovane knock down. 1:1.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Jakub Piotrowski (Udinese)
comes onto the pitch for Keinan Davis.

Kosta Runjaic decides to make a substitution.
Jordan Zemura will be replaced by Hassane
Kamara (Udinese).

The manager has been forced to make a substitution
and the injured Suat Serdar (Verona) leaves
the pitch to be replaced by Enzo Ebosse.

Paolo Zanetti has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Daniel Oyegoke (Verona) replacing
Fallou Cham.

Enzo Ebosse (Verona) receives a yellow card
from the referee for a foul that he committed
a little earlier.

Nicolo Bertola (Udinese) violates the rules
and gets a yellow card.

Rafik Belghali (Verona) is cautioned by
the referee for a foul that he committed
a little earlier.

This is definitely not what Isak Hien (Atalanta)
wanted. Attempting to intercept an offensive
pass, he scored an own goal and made it
0:1.

Alberto Arena shows a yellow card to Daniel
Maldini (Atalanta) for his blatant foul.

Gianluca Scamacca (Atalanta) has acres of
space after latching on to a precise pass
into the box. He doesn't hesitate to release
a low effort which ends up in the bottom
right corner.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Henrik Meister departs the
field of play to be replaced by M'Bala Nzola
(Pisa).

Substitution. Matteo Tramoni did his best
and is replaced by Juan Cuadrado (Pisa).

Alberto Gilardino has decided to make a
change. Ebenezer Akinsanmiro (Pisa) replaces
Stefano Moreo.

Mario Pasalic comes off the pitch to be
replaced by Ederson (Atalanta).

Here is a change. Daniel Maldini is going
off and Ivan Juric gives the last tactical
orders to Kamaldeen Sulemana (Atalanta).

We are about to witness a substitution.
Nikola Krstovic (Atalanta) is replacing
Gianluca Scamacca.

Substitution. Gabriele Piccinini (Pisa)
has come on for Marius Marin.

Daniel Denoon (Pisa) is being substituted
because of an injury. Alberto Gilardino
sends Arturo Calabresi on the pitch.

Kamaldeen Sulemana (Atalanta) can't expect
anything else than a yellow card for his
hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Alberto
Arena didn't think twice about pulling it
out of his pocket.

Substitution. Charles De Ketelaere is replaced
by Lazar Samardzic (Atalanta).

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Odilon Kossounou (Atalanta)
comes onto the pitch so that Giorgio Scalvini
can be given a rest.
Federico Gatti (Juventus) is booked.

Igor Tudor (Juventus) gets a yellow card,
off the field.

Zion Suzuki (Parma) is shown the yellow
card for talking out of turn to the referee.
It could have been worse!

Here is a change. Christian Ordonez is going
off and Carlos Cuesta gives the last tactical
orders to Oliver Sorensen (Parma).

Substitution. Federico Gatti did his best
and is replaced by Joao Mario (Juventus).

Manuel Locatelli goes off the pitch and
Teun Koopmeiners (Juventus) comes on.

Goal! Kenan Yildiz provides Jonathan David
(Juventus) with a nice pass inside the box.
It allows him to finish with a precise effort
into the bottom right corner. 1:0.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Oliver Sorensen (Parma) was quite harsh
and Matteo Marcenaro didn't hesitate to
show him a yellow card.

Jonathan David will be replaced by Dusan
Vlahovic (Juventus).

Carlos Cuesta prepares a substitution. Pontus
Almqvist is replaced by Adrian Benedyczak
(Parma).

The substitution is prepared. Nicolas Gonzalez
(Juventus) joins the action as a substitute,
replacing Francisco Conceicao.

Andrea Cambiaso (Juventus) reacts stupidly
and the referee shows him a deserved red
card!

Goal! Dusan Vlahovic (Juventus) beautifully
controls a strongly hit pass from Kenan
Yildiz inside the box. He cuts inside his
marker and rifles the ball into the bottom
left corner. 2:0.

Substitution. Mathias Lovik is replaced
by Nahuel Estevez (Parma).

Carlos Cuesta has decided to make a change.
Milan Djuric (Parma) replaces Mandela Keita.

It's time for a substitution. Weston McKennie
(Juventus) comes on in place of Kenan Yildiz.

Adam Obert (Cagliari) is booked after bringing
down an opponent. Simone Sozza had an easy-decision
to make.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Gennaro Borrelli (Cagliari) was quite
harsh and Simone Sozza didn't hesitate to
show him a yellow card.

Stefano Pioli makes a switch. Mattia Viti
is coming on in place of Luca Ranieri (Fiorentina)
at the start of the second period.

Half-time substitution. Cher Ndour (Fiorentina)
is replaced by Rolando Mandragora.

The referee signals a substitution. Zito
Luvumbo (Cagliari) is brought on as a substitute
for Sebastiano Esposito.

Fabio Pisacane has decided to make a change.
Luca Mazzitelli (Cagliari) replaces Matteo
Prati.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Pietro Comuzzo leaves the
pitch and Pablo Mari (Fiorentina) comes
on.

Albert Gudmundsson displays his great technique
and produces a beautiful lofted cross into
the box. Rolando Mandragora (Fiorentina)
gets onto the scoresheet by sweetly heading
it in off the left post – 0:1.

Marin Pongracic (Fiorentina) earns the yellow
card.

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Jacopo Fazzini (Fiorentina)
comes onto the pitch so that Albert Gudmundsson
can be given a rest.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Alessandro Deiola departs
the field of play to be replaced by Gianluca
Gaetano (Cagliari).

Fabio Pisacane has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Riyad Idrissi (Cagliari)
replacing Adam Obert.

Substitution. Fabiano Parisi (Fiorentina)
has come on for Robin Gosens.

The whistle blows and Pablo Mari (Fiorentina)
is booked for an infringement.

Substitution. Gennaro Borrelli is replaced
by Semih Kilicsoy (Cagliari).

Simone Sozza shows a yellow card to Luca
Mazzitelli (Cagliari) for his blatant foul.

Perfectly taken free kick! Gianluca Gaetano
sends the ball in, Sebastiano Luperto (Cagliari)
manages to jump highest near the penalty
spot and plants a cracking header low inside
the left post. It's 1:1.

Semih Kilicsoy (Cagliari) has tested the
patience of referee Simone Sozza and goes
into the book for a previous late challenge.

Nico Paz (Como) receives a yellow card from
the referee as expected.

Mattia Zaccagni (Lazio) can count himself
lucky for not being sent off after only
receiving a caution from the referee.

The referee is firm and issues Ignace Van
der Brempt (Como) a deserved yellow card.

Anastasios Douvikas (Como) makes a great
solo run and pulls the trigger from inside
the box, beating Ivan Provedel with a strike
into the bottom left corner. He makes it
1:0.

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Pedro (Lazio) will replace
Matteo Cancellieri.

Maurizio Sarri prepares a substitution.
Manuel Lazzari is replaced by Adam Marusic
(Lazio).

Here comes the VAR verdict. NO GOAL for
Lazio due to an offside in the build-up
play.

Here's the change. Danilo Cataldi leaves
the pitch and Nicolo Rovella (Lazio) comes
on as a substitute.

Here is a change. Nuno Tavares is going
off and Maurizio Sarri gives the last tactical
orders to Luca Pellegrini (Lazio).

The game has come to an end for Anastasios
Douvikas. He has contributed as much as
he could today. He will be replaced by the
fresh legs of Alvaro Morata (Como).

Cesc Fabregas decides to make a substitution.
Ignace Van der Brempt will be replaced by
Ivan Smolcic (Como).

Nico Paz (Como) takes a fantastic free kick
and the ball ends up in the back of the
net! He unleashes a shot from 20 metres
out which goes towards the top left corner,
ricocheting in off the post. A truly sensational
moment.

Matteo Guendouzi (Lazio) is given a fully
deserved yellow card.

A yellow card is awarded to Taty Castellanos
(Lazio).

The referee signals a substitution. Boulaye
Dia (Lazio) is brought on as a substitute
for Fisayo Dele-Bashiru.

Cesc Fabregas has decided to make a change.
Maxence Caqueret (Como) replaces Maximo
Perrone.

A substitution has been made. Nico Paz is
replaced by Sergi Roberto (Como).

Substitution. Jesus Rodriguez walks off
the pitch and Nicolas-Gerrit Kuhn (Como)
comes on as a substitute.

Alessio Zerbin produces a beautiful lofted
cross into the box, where Federico Baschirotto
(Cremonese) rises high to head the ball
into the left side of the goal and beyond
the goalkeeper. He makes it 0:1.

It's a goal! Strahinja Pavlovic (AC Milan)
makes it 1:1. He jumped highest to connect
with a perfect cross from Pervis Estupinan
and planted his close-range header into
the right side of the goal. Emil Audero
was helpless.

Half-time substitution. Pervis Estupinan
will not participate anymore and Alejandro
Jimenez (AC Milan) is coming on.

Alberto Grassi (Cremonese) sees a yellow
card from Giuseppe Collu after he sent one
of the opposing players to the ground.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Jari Vandeputte trots off
the pitch and is replaced by Martin Payero
(Cremonese).

Davide Nicola prepares a substitution. Alberto
Grassi is replaced by Warren Bondo (Cremonese).

GOOOOOAL! Federico Bonazzoli (Cremonese)
finds space in the box from the lofted pass
and lands the perfect scissor-kick goal.
G.O.A.T? Probably not, but it’s 1:2.

Here is a change. Fikayo Tomori is going
off and Massimiliano Allegri gives the last
tactical orders to Samuel Chukwueze (AC
Milan).

A substitution has been made. David Okereke
goes off and Antonio Sanabria (Cremonese)
comes on.

Filippo Terracciano (Cremonese) picks up
a yellow card for a foul.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Ardon Jashari (AC Milan)
replaces Luka Modric.

Giuseppe Collu shows a yellow card to Martin
Payero (Cremonese), who isn't surprised
as the tackle was really hard and late.

Alejandro Jimenez (AC Milan) attempts to
discuss the decision with Giuseppe Collu,
but he soon realises that it's not the right
thing to do as he sees the yellow.

Davide Nicola has decided to substitute
Matteo Bianchetti and he is replaced by
Federico Ceccherini (Cremonese).

It is time for a substitution. Manuel De
Luca (Cremonese) is on for Federico Bonazzoli.

Warren Bondo (Cremonese) is the one who
receives a yellow card.

Remo Freuler (Bologna) has to be very careful
for the rest of the match after receiving
a yellow card from the referee for a bad
tackle on an opponent.

Ciro Immobile is being substituted because
of an injury. Vincenzo Italiano sends Santiago
Castro (Bologna) on the pitch.

The manager has been forced to make a substitution
and the injured Nicolo Casale limps off
the pitch to be replaced by Martin Vitik
(Bologna).

Goal! The ball breaks to Wesley Franca (AS
Roma) after some poor defending, he finds
himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and
calmly puts the ball into the back of the
net! He makes it 1:0.

The referee signals a substitution. Neil
El Aynaoui (AS Roma) is brought on as a
substitute for Stephan El Shaarawy.

Yellow card. Gianluca Mancini (AS Roma)
goes into the book for a bad tackle on his
opponent.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Nadir Zortea (Bologna) replaces
Lorenzo De Silvestri.

Vincenzo Italiano prepares a substitution.
Jens Odgaard is replaced by Giovanni Fabbian
(Bologna).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Evan Ferguson trots off
the pitch and is replaced by Artem Dovbyk
(AS Roma).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Matias Soule leaves the
pitch and Paulo Dybala (AS Roma) comes on.

Vincenzo Italiano decides to make a substitution.
Remo Freuler will be replaced by Federico
Bernardeschi (Bologna).

Substitution. Angelino will be replaced
by Devyne Rensch (AS Roma).

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Lameck Banda (Lecce) was quite harsh
and Davide Massa didn't hesitate to show
him a yellow card.

Danilo Veiga (Lecce) is booked after bringing
down an opponent. Davide Massa had an easy-decision
to make.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Lameck Banda departs the
field of play to be replaced by Riccardo
Sottil (Lecce).

Eusebio Di Francesco prepares a substitution.
Medon Berisha is replaced by Mohamed Kaba
(Lecce).

Here comes a substitution. Albert Gronbaek
is given a rest as he is replaced by Junior
Messias (Genoa).

Substitution. Christ-Owen Kouassi (Lecce)
replaces Danilo Veiga.

Patrick Vieira has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Mikael Egill Ellertsson
(Genoa) replacing Valentin Carboni.

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Jeff Ekhator (Genoa)
is coming onto the pitch as Lorenzo Colombo
cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Aaron Martin (Genoa) has tested the patience
of referee Davide Massa and goes into the
book for a previous late challenge.

Tete Morente (Lecce) makes a bad challenge
on his opponent and is booked by the referee.

We are about to witness a subsitution. Balthazar
Pierret (Lecce) for Lassana Coulibaly.

Here is a change. Francesco Camarda is going
off and Eusebio Di Francesco gives the last
tactical orders to Konan Ndri (Lecce).

Jeff Ekhator (Genoa) is awarded a yellow
card.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Nicolae Stanciu leaves the
pitch and Morten Thorsby (Genoa) comes on.

Morten Frendrup will be replaced by Vitinha
(Genoa).

It's a goal! Scott McTominay (Napoli) makes
it 0:1. He jumped highest to connect with
a perfect cross from Matteo Politano and
planted his close-range header into the
top right corner. Stefano Turati was helpless.

Lorenzo Lucca (Napoli) sees a yellow card
from Giovanni Ayroldi after he sent one
of the opposing players to the ground.

Domenico Berardi (Sassuolo) is awarded a
yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem
to agree with the decision, but Giovanni
Ayroldi ignores the protests.

Kevin De Bruyne (Napoli) shoots from the
free kick just outside the box and curls
the ball inside the right post. What a brilliant
goal that is!

The foul by Ismael Kone (Sassuolo) is worthy
of a card and a yellow is duly shown by
Giovanni Ayroldi.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Luca Lipani departs the
field of play to be replaced by Alieu Fadera
(Sassuolo).

Antonio Conte has decided to make a change.
David Neres (Napoli) replaces Matteo Politano.

It is too late to protest. Ismael Kone (Sassuolo)
knew very well what he was doing and subsequently
receives a second yellow card, ending the
match for him.

The manager has decided to make a substitution
and Armand Lauriente walks off the pitch
to be replaced by Andrea Ghion (Sassuolo).

Fabio Grosso decides to make a substitution.
Josh Doig will be replaced by Fali Cande
(Sassuolo).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Billy Gilmour (Napoli) comes
onto the pitch for Stanislav Lobotka.

The referee allows time for a substitution.
Lorenzo Lucca will be replaced by Noa Lang
(Napoli).

We are about to witness a substitution.
Antonio Vergara (Napoli) is replacing Scott
McTominay.

Here is a change. Mathias Olivera is going
off and Antonio Conte gives the last tactical
orders to Leonardo Spinazzola (Napoli).

Substitution. Nicholas Pierini (Sassuolo)
in, Domenico Berardi out.

The substitution is prepared. Luca Moro
(Sassuolo) joins the action as a substitute,
replacing Andrea Pinamonti.
